benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search - Search custom fields by type, name and optional value

covered: Valid Request: Extensive positive cases covering no-params, individual params (objectType, fieldName, fieldValue), combined params, and audit modes (FULL, MINIMAL, NONE).
Empty Response: Explicit scenarios for no matching results and empty-database states (TC11, TC28).
Pagination: Offset/limit behavior and edge cases (offset that exceeds size, limit large values, paging slice) are covered (TC07, TC21, TC22).

Query Parameters: Wide variety of parameter combinations are exercised, including partial inputs, unexpected params (ignored), invalid values (invalid objectType, invalid offset/limit), and SQLi/XSS attempts. (TC02-TC06, TC12-TC16, TC19-TC20, TC37).
Error Handling: Negative/zero pagination, invalid audit and objectType values, and invalid input cases have explicit error expectations (TC13-TC16, TC19-TC20).
Audit & Integration: Behavior with audit parameter and integration/degradation of audit service are tested (TC08-TC10, TC18, TC32-TC33).
Performance & Scalability: Response-time/performance scenarios under normal and peak loads are present (TC24, TC30, TC31) and concurrency is covered (TC23).
Regression/Backward Compatibility: Regression checks and backward-compatibility scenario for objectType-only clients are included (TC25-TC27).
Accessibility/Documentation/Error UX: Documentation and descriptive error message requirements are covered (TC34-TC35).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests inspect response caching headers (Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified) or 304 Not Modified behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests validate rate-limit responses, retries after throttling, or behavior under high-frequency calls (distinct from concurrency/performance).
Authorization scope/roles: Only authentication-missing (401) is covered — there are no tests for forbidden access (403) or role-based restrictions if applicable.
Response headers & content-type: Tests do not assert response headers such as Content-Type, Vary, or pagination-related headers (if any).
Error response schema: While error cases are present, there are no explicit assertions on the error response structure (error code, message, details) and consistency with API error schema.

Parameter type coercion & encoding: No tests for non-integer string inputs for offset/limit (e.g., limit=abc), for URL-encoded/special-character parameter handling, or very-long parameter strings beyond SQLi/XSS examples.
Deterministic pagination ordering: Tests assume pagination slice but do not assert stable ordering or sort guarantees across pages (which affects correctness of pagination).

Limit boundaries and defaults: There is no explicit test verifying default limit (100) behavior, maximum enforced limit (if there is one), or behavior when client requests above-maximum limits (rate/size protections).
Caching-invalidation and stale audit data: Integration tests check audit consistency but do not cover cache invalidation or staleness scenarios involving cached responses vs audit log changes.
recommendations: Add caching tests: assert Cache-Control, ETag/If-None-Match flows and 304 responses; test Last-Modified and cache invalidation scenarios.
Introduce rate-limiting / throttling tests: simulate high-frequency requests and assert 429 responses and retry-after behavior per policy.
Add authorization role tests: verify 403 Forbidden for authenticated users lacking sufficient permissions, and cover any role-specific filtering if applicable.
Assert response headers: add checks for Content-Type (application/json), pagination headers (if used), and other relevant response metadata.
Specify and assert error response schema: for invalid inputs, assert structured error code, message, and optional details to ensure consistent error contracts.

Test parameter type and encoding edge-cases: include non-integer strings for offset/limit, extremely long fieldName/fieldValue strings, and URL-encoded special characters to validate input sanitization and parsing.
Add deterministic pagination tests: verify ordering guarantees (e.g., sort by createdDate or id) and that pagination across pages returns a consistent, non-overlapping ordered set.
Validate default and maximum limits: add tests confirming default limit=100 behavior and how API handles requests above any configured maximum (e.g., limit=10000).
Add cache vs audit consistency tests: when audit info changes, ensure cached GET responses reflect policy (fresh vs stale) or are invalidated appropriately.
